contentrichtext.text: {{Refimprove|date=October 2010}} '''The Merton Parkas''' were a [[mod revival]] [[band (music)|band]], formed in the [[London Borough of Merton|Merton]] area of [[South London]] in the mid-1970s, by Danny Talbot ([[singing|vocals]] and [[guitar]]), his [[sibling|brother]], [[Mick Talbot]] ([[keyboard instrument|keyboards]]), Neil Hurrell ([[bass guitar|bass]]) and Simon Smith ([[drum]]s). They signed with the [[indie music|independent]] [[record label]], [[Beggars Banquet Records|Beggars Banquet]]. They were discovered playing in a pub in Clapham, South London by Alan Anger,punk journalist. Their name at first was The Sneekers and they were a part of the Powerpop bands that included The Pleasers. The Merton Parkas released a few moderately successful [[single (music)|singles]], such as: "You Need Wheels", "Plastic Smile", "Give it to Me Now" and "Put Me in the Picture". They also released one [[album]], ''Face in the Crowd''. [[Rick Buckler]] of [[The Jam]] played with the band at [[Ronnie Scotts]] and Mick Talbot appeared on an album by The Jam. He played on Heatwave. After the group disbanded in 1980, Mick Talbot went on to play with [[Dexys Midnight Runners]], [[The Bureau]], and [[The Style Council]]. Simon Smith went on to join psychedelic revival band, Mood Six. The Merton Parkas' most notable [[song|track]] was "You Need Wheels", which reached #40 in the [[UK Singles Chart]] in the summer of 1979.<ref name="British Hit Singles & Albums">{{cite book | first= David | last= Roberts | year= 2006 | title= British Hit Singles & Albums | edition= 19th | publisher= Guinness World Records Limited | location= London | pages= 361 | isbn= 1-904994-10-5}}</ref> As this was their only success in that [[record chart|chart]], they are referred to as [[One-hit wonders in the UK|one-hit wonders]]. ==See also== *[[Merton Park]] *[[List of Peel sessions]] *[[List of bands from England]] *[[Mod revival]] *[[List of performers on Top of the Pops]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[{{Allmusic|class=artist|id=p19306|pure_url=yes}} Merton Parkas biography] at the [[Allmusic]] [[website]] *[http://www.thepurplehearts.co.uk/merton_parkas/Merton_Parkas.html Merton Parkas bio & info] *[http://www.thepurplehearts.co.uk/buy.html Find Merton Parkas & Mod music] {{DEFAULTSORT:Merton Parkas, The}} [[Category:English rock music groups]] [[Category:Musical groups from London]] [[Category:Media and communications in Merton]] [[Category:Mod revival]] [[Category:Musical groups disestablished in 1980]]
